meanings.definition: Prussianises (verb): to make something resemble or adopt characteristics of Prussian culture or society.
meanings.sent1: She prussianises her wardrobe by adding traditional Prussian patterns to her clothes.
meanings.sent2: The museum exhibit prussianises the room with artifacts and displays from Prussian history.
meanings.sent3: The birthday party theme prussianises the decorations with Prussian flags and colors.
meanings.sent4: His speech prussianises the audience, transporting them to the era of Prussian dominance.
meanings.sent5: The novel vividly prussianises the setting, immersing readers in the world of Prussian influence.
